aggregateIdeology.reasoning: Cunningham, Bianca focuses on issues such as Education, Elections & Democracy, Affordable Housing. The statements emphasize a strong commitment to public education, community engagement, and equity, reflecting progressive values. The focus on fully funding public schools, reducing school suspensions, and integrating diverse curricula indicates a desire for systemic change in education.

Affordable Housing.stanceExplanation: The statements emphasize a strong commitment to affordable housing as a fundamental right, advocating for sustainable development and union labor, which aligns with progressive values. Additionally, the focus on community investment, mental health services, and holding slumlords accountable further reflects a progressive stance on social equity and housing justice. Overall, the proposals indicate a comprehensive approach to addressing housing issues, prioritizing the needs of vulnerable populations.
highlights: We know that development has to happen in Brownsville and I support development of sustainable, affordable housing.
I will fight to build affordable housing with 100% union labor and regulate AI so that those jobs stay with hard working New Yorkers.
We know that development has to happen in Brownsville and I support development of sustainable, affordable housing.

Policing & Public Safety.stanceExplanation: The statements reflect a strong commitment to progressive values, emphasizing community organizing, racial justice, and reducing police funding in favor of public services. The focus on anti-capitalist education and mutual aid initiatives further highlights a progressive stance on social equity and public safety. Overall, the actions and initiatives described align closely with progressive movements advocating for systemic change.
highlights: I mentored high school and middle school students and developed anti capitalist political science curriculum to present in classrooms around the city Organized and AfroSocialist weekend long convention that included organizing 101 and historical content for 50 Black and brown activists across the city at Rosa Luxemburg Stiftung Hosted a panel on Gentrification that featured tenant organizers from Brooklyn that discussed gentrification I was a keynote speaker for an event to commemorate Brazilian activist Marielle Franco held by Mulheres da ResistÃªncia no Exterior Testified and organized with public hospital workers in Harlem Hospital to stop the closure Guest lecturer at CUNY graduate school on political engagement and power mapping Organized mutual aid health and wellness events in Crown Heights Organized a march in support of Eric Garnerâs family looking  to hold Daniel Pantaleo charged with murder Helped to organize a press conference at City Hall in response to the murder of Saheed Vassell Has had writings about racial justice, politics and labor published in major media publications I was one of the core organizers that called for the occupation of City Hall Park in 2020 to pressure the council to vote for fully funded public services and reducing the NYPD  budget.

I mentored high school and middle school students and developed anti capitalist political science curriculum to present in classrooms around the city Organized and AfroSocialist weekend long convention that included organizing 101 and historical content for 50 Black and brown activists across the city at Rosa Luxemburg Stiftung Hosted a panel on Gentrification that featured tenant organizers from Brooklyn that discussed gentrification I was a keynote speaker for an event to commemorate Brazilian activist Marielle Franco held by Mulheres da ResistÃªncia no Exterior Testified and organized with public hospital workers in Harlem Hospital to stop the closure Guest lecturer at CUNY graduate school on political engagement and power mapping Organized mutual aid health and wellness events in Crown Heights Organized a march in support of Eric Garnerâs family looking  to hold Daniel Pantaleo charged with murder Helped to organize a press conference at City Hall in response to the murder of Saheed Vassell Has had writings about racial justice, politics and labor published in major media publications I was one of the core organizers that called for the occupation of City Hall Park in 2020 to pressure the council to vote for fully funded public services and reducing the NYPD  budget.

I worked in coalition with Communities United for Police Reform to pass  the Right to Know Act I worked to train and support hundreds of workers around the city to unionize and improve their working conditions I helped develop the campaign for postal banking with APWU canvassing banking deserts like the Bronx and Brooklyn I founded the AfroSocialists and Socialists of Color caucus and grew it to be national with caucuses in over 6 states Established AfroSocialists chapters on 3  HBCU campuses Partnered with Organizing for Equity to develop a campaign  that reduced the number of days for school suspensions for public school students in NYC.

Education.stanceExplanation: The statements emphasize a strong commitment to public education, community engagement, and equity, reflecting progressive values. The focus on fully funding public schools, reducing school suspensions, and integrating diverse curricula indicates a desire for systemic change in education. Additionally, the advocacy for community schools and participatory budgeting further aligns with progressive educational policies aimed at inclusivity and accessibility.

About  About Platform  Platform Press  Press Volunteer  Volunteer      Main Menu    About  About Platform  Platform Press  Press Volunteer  Volunteer  About  About Platform  Platform Press  Press Volunteer  Volunteer      Main Menu    About  About Platform  Platform Press  Press Volunteer  Volunteer Bianca Cunningham for City Council District 41 Vote Tuesday, June 24th Volunteer Meet Bianca Bianca is a union leader and community organizer who has been fighting on the front lines for higher wages for all workers, worker safety, and securing resources and public safety for all public school students, regardless of race, gender, and income.

I worked in coalition with Communities United for Police Reform to pass  the Right to Know Act I worked to train and support hundreds of workers around the city to unionize and improve their working conditions I helped develop the campaign for postal banking with APWU canvassing banking deserts like the Bronx and Brooklyn I founded the AfroSocialists and Socialists of Color caucus and grew it to be national with caucuses in over 6 states Established AfroSocialists chapters on 3  HBCU campuses Partnered with Organizing for Equity to develop a campaign  that reduced the number of days for school suspensions for public school students in NYC.

I mentored high school and middle school students and developed anti capitalist political science curriculum to present in classrooms around the city Organized and AfroSocialist weekend long convention that included organizing 101 and historical content for 50 Black and brown activists across the city at Rosa Luxemburg Stiftung Hosted a panel on Gentrification that featured tenant organizers from Brooklyn that discussed gentrification I was a keynote speaker for an event to commemorate Brazilian activist Marielle Franco held by Mulheres da ResistÃªncia no Exterior Testified and organized with public hospital workers in Harlem Hospital to stop the closure Guest lecturer at CUNY graduate school on political engagement and power mapping Organized mutual aid health and wellness events in Crown Heights Organized a march in support of Eric Garnerâs family looking  to hold Daniel Pantaleo charged with murder Helped to organize a press conference at City Hall in response to the murder of Saheed Vassell Has had writings about racial justice, politics and labor published in major media publications I was one of the core organizers that called for the occupation of City Hall Park in 2020 to pressure the council to vote for fully funded public services and reducing the NYPD  budget.

Climate & Environment.stanceExplanation: The statements emphasize a strong commitment to environmental justice, community health, and sustainable development through initiatives like building 100% affordable housing and retrofitting buildings for energy efficiency. The focus on green jobs and local hiring metrics indicates a progressive approach to economic and environmental issues. Additionally, the integration of health and safety with environmental factors reflects a holistic understanding of community well-being, aligning closely with progressive values.
highlights: Learn More Expanding Apprenticeship Programs for local residents Re-Entry programs for returning citizens Building 100% Union Green Jobs Local Hiring metrics tied to all new projects and businesses in the district Building new development 100% affordable according to the neighborhood  local median household income NOT t he AMI Healthy Communities I believe that our sense of safety is tied directly to our health outcomes and our environment.

That means we need to invest in the following: 24-7 Mobile crisis units as first responders  non-violent 9-1-1 calls More Green spaces Supporting the call for universal child care specifically addressing parents with non traditional work schedules Investing in Community Healing Circles Fulfilling the Brownsville Mandate by funding and expanding the existing violence interruption organizations Funding Mental Health clinics Funding supplemental cleaning services that hire formerly incarcerated or homeless folks like ACE, CTE Fully Funded Public hospitals Reopening psychiatric beds in public hospitals Retrofitting Buildings and homes to make them more energy efficient Reopening cooling centers that have been shut down by Adams Funding  DSNY mobile litter patrols Housing is a Human Right I support the Rent Freeze Building new developments as 100% affordable according to the neighborhood  local median household income NOT the AMI Holding Slumlords accountable for their negligence Our Seniors Should Retire with Dignity I will work to protect pensions and expand funding to foreclosure prevention programs that support seniors at risk of deed or equity theft.

Expanding Apprenticeship Programs for local residents Re-Entry programs for returning citizens Building 100% Union Green Jobs Local Hiring metrics tied to all new projects and businesses in the district Building new development 100% affordable according to the neighborhood  local median household income NOT t he AMI Healthy Communities I believe that our sense of safety is tied directly to our health outcomes and our environment.

LGBTQ+ Rights.stanceExplanation: The statements focus on labor rights and anti-discrimination for formerly incarcerated workers, which suggests a moderate stance on social justice issues. However, there is no direct mention of LGBTQ+ rights, making it difficult to assess a clear progressive or conservative position on that specific topic. The involvement in union support indicates a level of advocacy for marginalized groups, but it does not explicitly address LGBTQ+ issues.
highlights: I also supported the trades during the #CountMeIn fight which was a multitiered fight to ensure the Hudson Yards was built 100% union and to stop the discrimination and villainization of formerly incarcerated workers on the job site.

I also supported the trades during the #CountMeIn fight which was a multitiered fight to ensure the Hudson Yards was built 100% union and to stop the discrimination and villainization of formerly incarcerated workers on the job site.

Economic Development.stanceExplanation: The statements emphasize a strong commitment to economic equity through job training, affordable housing, and union labor, which aligns with progressive values. The focus on local hiring, apprenticeship programs, and re-entry initiatives reflects a desire to uplift marginalized communities and ensure fair labor practices. Additionally, the regulation of AI to protect jobs indicates a forward-thinking approach to economic development that prioritizes workers' rights and community well-being.
highlights: Brownsville has one of the highest unemployment rates in the city I want to see more young people and public housing residents trained to get good paying union jobs by expanding apprenticeship programs,  bringing trades back into schools and funding re entry programs for returning citizens Essential Workers Make Our City Run!
I will fight to build affordable housing with 100% union labor and regulate AI so that those jobs stay with hard working New Yorkers.

Learn More Expanding Apprenticeship Programs for local residents Re-Entry programs for returning citizens Building 100% Union Green Jobs Local Hiring metrics tied to all new projects and businesses in the district Building new development 100% affordable according to the neighborhood  local median household income NOT t he AMI Healthy Communities I believe that our sense of safety is tied directly to our health outcomes and our environment.

Homelessness.stanceExplanation: The statements advocate for extensive social services, including mental health support, affordable housing, and community investment, which align with progressive values. The emphasis on housing as a human right and the call for a rent freeze further highlight a commitment to addressing systemic inequalities. Additionally, the focus on supporting marginalized populations, such as formerly incarcerated individuals and seniors, underscores a progressive approach to social welfare.

Health Care Access.stanceExplanation: The statements advocate for comprehensive health care access through various initiatives, including funding for mental health clinics and public hospitals. They emphasize community-based solutions and support for vulnerable populations, reflecting a progressive stance on health care as a human right. Additionally, the call for universal child care and affordable housing further aligns with progressive values focused on social equity and support for marginalized communities.

Elections & Democracy.stanceExplanation: The statements emphasize progressive values such as community organizing, racial justice, and labor rights, which align with a progressive stance on elections and democracy. The focus on ranked choice voting and grassroots campaigning indicates a desire for more inclusive and representative electoral processes. Additionally, the involvement in social justice movements and advocacy for public services reflects a commitment to equity and systemic change, typical of a progressive agenda.
highlights: This year kicks off a slew of city council elections,"}] District 41 Bedford-Stuyvesant (East), Crown Heights (North), Lincoln Terrace Park, Crown Heights (South), Prospect Lefferts Gardens-Wingate, Ocean Hill, Brownsville, East Flatbush-Rugby, East Flatbush-Remsen Village Find Your Polling Site Ranked Choice Voting FAQ Vote Tuesday, June 24th How to Fill out your rank choice voting ballot How your ballot will be counted Volunteer for Bianca’s Campaign One of the most crucial parts of Bianca’s campaign in making sure she gets on the ballot!
